messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] New Photo
messages.msgSnippet: Good job with the photo shop! I honestly thought you were in a studio with a backdrop paper roll that you stand on. Robin Yule I m glad you like it. We did it
messages.messageBody:
Good job with the photo shop! I honestly thought you were in a studio with a backdrop paper roll that you stand on.
Robin Yule

I'm glad you like it. We did it ourselves. Clamped the camera to the fascia
board of the roof outside the kitchen door. Used a step ladder to push the
self timer, scampered down for the snap. I got some amusing very close ups
when I pushed the wrong button. That side of the house was in full shadow
around noon, so we were lit with nothing but soft, even, sky light on a
slightly overcast day. I took out the background with photoshop.

-Dan Vilter

messages.msgSnippet: ... I m glad you like it. We did it ourselves. Clamped the camera to the fascia board of the roof outside the kitchen door. Used a step ladder to push the self
messages.messageBody:
on 12/29/02 6:27 PM, Robin at YuleMom@... wrote:

> I love the photo! Did you have it professionally done? I like the angle and
> would like to try it with our family.

I'm glad you like it. We did it ourselves. Clamped the camera to the fascia
board of the roof outside the kitchen door. Used a step ladder to push the
self timer, scampered down for the snap. I got some amusing very close ups
when I pushed the wrong button. That side of the house was in full shadow
around noon, so we were lit with nothing but soft, even, sky light on a
slightly overcast day. I took out the background with photoshop.

-Dan Vilter

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] New Photo
messages.msgSnippet: I love the photo! Did you have it professionally done? I like the angle and would like to try it with our family. Robin Yule If anyone is interested, we just
messages.messageBody:
I love the photo! Did you have it professionally done? I like the angle and would like to try it with our family.
Robin Yule
If anyone is interested, we just posted our new 2002 Christmas portrait in
the photo section. It was taken yesterday. You're seeing it before the
relatives do.

-Dan Vilter

messages.subject: Re: New Photo
messages.msgSnippet: ... I just tried it and had no problem. How about your original file name? Is it more than eight characters with any punctuation marks in the middle? Peggy
messages.messageBody:
Nancy <Dnowens@...> wrote:

>
> I've tried twice to put photos on and no luck. I get through the whole
> process and hit upload and the little blue line zips across and then nothing.
> I'm sure I did everything right and that is usually my first mistake. <g> So
> if someone wants to give me a few pointers, that would be wonderful!
>
> ~Nancy

I just tried it and had no problem. How about your original file name? Is it
more than eight characters with any punctuation marks in the middle?

Peggy

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] New Photo
messages.msgSnippet: I ve tried twice to put photos on and no luck. I get through the whole process and hit upload and the little blue line zips across and then nothing. I m sure I
messages.messageBody:
I've tried twice to put photos on and no luck. I get through the whole
process and hit upload and the little blue line zips across and then nothing.
I'm sure I did everything right and that is usually my first mistake. <g> So
if someone wants to give me a few pointers, that would be wonderful!

~Nancy
